segments.text: Don't take anything away from him. He gave me a better fight than all the boxers did in the last 10 years.
I think that's been the toughest fight I've had for years.
There's no who to blame. Blame me. There's no blame the trainer, blame the manager, blame the cup man.
Blame me if you're going to blame anybody. It was what it was. It's a fight game.
It's not tap dancing. You go in there, you have a fight and that's it. You get out of there, you get paid.
The good thing is, I've got paid, I'm going home to my family and we're going to the next Undisputed Fight.
So, happy days. There is no excuses. You're in there on the night, I've done the best I could, that's it.
There's no excuses. Oh, I didn't perform well because I didn't tie my shoelaces in a certain manner.
Listen, it was what it was. It was a tough fight. He was a good game man and that was it.
There's nothing else I can say about it. He was a good fella and I did my best and that was it.
I won the fight and out we go on to the next one. I've been paid, been laid and we go home now. That's it.
